comments.text:
Does anyone know that Lithium Ion batteries on recent smartphones have this 
built-in chip that blocks battery charging when it's full? that's the 
reason why your battery doesn't stay at 100% when it's plugged in, when it 
goes to 99 or 98% it's gonna start charging again.﻿

comments.author: Madison “okaymadisonnn” Garcia

comments.text:
An another tip (I think): when you go to sleep and you listen to music and 
then you fall asleep, don't let your phone playing music all the night. 

Android users: make a playlist of the song you listen most, and don't put 
play all or play again.

iOS users: if you listen to music, open the clock app and go to timer. Set 
for example 20 minutes and then tap at "when time stops"
. Scroll down and you will see the "stop playing". Then when the time 
passes, the iPhone automatically closes the music.

Thumbs up if you like it!😉﻿

comments.text:
when you go to sleep and don't need to charge the phone,  or when not 
planning to use it for a while, SHUT IT DOWN. Do NOT set it into standby. 
In standby, it can lose up to 15% every HOUR. When it is shut down, it will 
lose as little as 1% every 4 hours.﻿
